Legal_Issue: Whether the Officer erred in refusing the applicant's refugee claim under Convention refugee or country of asylum class
Application_Facts: Applicant feared persecution due to membership in a minority clan in Somalia; claimed Somaliland unsafe despite Internal Flight Alternative (IFA) finding
Court_Ruling: Decision found unreasonable and legally erroneous; judicial review allowed
Defendant_Behavior: Immigration Officer applied IFA and determined general insecurity not persecution
Grounds_for_Claim: Well-founded fear of persecution based on membership in particular social group (minority clan)
Legal_Standard: Section 96 (Convention refugee), Section 147 (Country of asylum class) of IRPA
Assessment_Factor: Existence of Internal Flight Alternative (IFA), level of personal risk, country conditions
Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly challenged; evidence accepted as sufficient to raise legitimate fear
Evidence_Used: Evidence of clan-based persecution, security situation in Somaliland
Application_Basis: Convention refugee abroad class and country of asylum class
Evidence_Assessed: Risk due to minority clan affiliation, safety of IFA in Somaliland
Relief_Sought: Grant of refugee protection, reassessment of claim
Governing_Rule: A Convention refugee must have a well-founded fear of persecution for a protected ground; country of asylum class applies where civil war or human rights violations cause serious harm
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Officer failed to adequately assess personal risk and conditions in Somaliland
Outcome: Judicial review allowed; case remanded for redetermination
Decisional_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB) / Refugee Protection Division
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution due to clan membership in Somalia
Cause_Description: Denial of refugee claim based on finding of general insecurity and viable IFA despite evidence of targeted risk
Evidence_Handling: Court found evidence was not properly weighed by the Officer
Evidence_Issues: Disregard of specific threats related to clan membership
Legal_Provision: Section 96 and Section 147, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient consideration of personal risk and country conditions
Decision_Rationale: Generalized violence does not preclude persecution; IFA must be realistically available and safe for the individual
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to engage with evidence on personal risk and safety of IFA
Legal_Standard_Applied: Well-founded fear of persecution, internal flight alternative
